Class HttpMessageReconstructor

java.lang.Object
ca.gc.cra.radar.infrastructure.protocol.http.HttpMessageReconstructor
All Implemented Interfaces:
MessageReconstructor
public final class HttpMessageReconstructor extends Object implements MessageReconstructor
Lightweight HTTP/1.x reconstructor that buffers per-direction payloads and emits complete header+body messages when Content-Length allows. Chunked bodies are emitted best-effort as a single payload containing the buffered bytes at the time of detection.

  • Constructor Details

    • HttpMessageReconstructor

      public HttpMessageReconstructor(ClockPort clock, MetricsPort metrics)
      Creates a reconstructor bound to the supplied clock and metrics sink.
      Parameters:
      clock - clock used for timestamping generated events
      metrics - metrics sink for HTTP-specific counters
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if clock or metrics is null
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc

  • Method Details

    • onStart

      public void onStart()
      Resets parser state at the beginning of a session.
      Specified by:
      onStart in interface MessageReconstructor
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc
      Implementation Note:
      Clears buffers for both directions and pending transaction ids.

    • onBytes

      public List<MessageEvent> onBytes(ByteStream slice)
      Parses HTTP bytes and emits zero or more message events.
      Specified by:
      onBytes in interface MessageReconstructor
      Parameters:
      slice - contiguous byte stream slice with flow metadata; must not be null
      Returns:
      list of message events extracted from the slice; may be empty
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if slice is null
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc
      Implementation Note:
      Associates responses with the oldest unmatched request id; chunked bodies emit buffered bytes once detected.

    • onClose

      public void onClose()
      Clears buffers at the end of the session.
      Specified by:
      onClose in interface MessageReconstructor
      Since:
      RADAR 0.1-doc
      Implementation Note:
      Pending transaction ids are dropped to avoid leaking across sessions.
